The car starts moving from rest on a straight highway.
The graph shows the change in acceleration over time.
Calculate the distance traveled by the car within 60 seconds.
The car accelerates from 0 to 10 seconds, then maintains a constant speed from 10 to 40 seconds, and finally decelerates from 40 to 60 seconds.
Calculate the distance traveled by the car.
The distance traveled is given by the sum of the distances traveled at each stage of acceleration and deceleration.
The car accelerates from 0 to 10 seconds with an acceleration of 2 m/s², covering a distance of 10 × 20 = 200 m.
The car then maintains a constant speed of 20 m/s from 10 to 40 seconds, covering a distance of 30 × 20 = 600 m.
The car decelerates from 40 to 60 seconds with an acceleration of -1 m/s², covering a distance of 20 × 20 = 400 m.
